title: Will Intel's stock price increase by 10% or more from its October 1, 2023 closing price by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Intel's stock price increases by 10% or more from its closing price on October 1, 2023, by August 31, 2024. The stock price will be based on the closing price on the last trading day of August 2024. If the stock price does not reach this threshold, if Intel is delisted, or if trading is suspended, the question resolves as NO. The reference price and final price will be adjusted for any stock splits or reverse splits that occur during this period.

title: Will Intel announce a new CEO by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Intel Corporation officially announces a new Chief Executive Officer (CEO) to replace the current CEO by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Intel statement or press release. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the current CEO remains in position, this question resolves as NO. Note that this question is not dependent on any specific events or circumstances leading up to a potential CEO change.

title: Will Intel's market share in the PC processor market fall below 70% by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if a reputable market research firm (such as IDC, Gartner, or Mercury Research) reports that Intel's market share in the PC processor market has fallen below 70% by August 31, 2024. The report must be published between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. If no such report is published within this timeframe or if Intel's market share remains at or above 70%, this question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'PC processor market' refers to x86 processors for desktop and laptop computers, excluding servers and mobile devices.

title: Will Intel announce a merger or acquisition valued at over $1 billion by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Intel officially announces a merger with another company or an acquisition of another company valued at over $1 billion USD by August 31, 2024. The announcement must come from an official Intel statement, press release, or regulatory filing. The valuation of the deal must be explicitly stated or easily calculable from the information provided in the announcement. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if any announced deals are valued at $1 billion USD or less, this question resolves as NO. Note that the announcement of the deal is sufficient for resolution; the deal does not need to be completed by the resolution date.

title: Will Jimmy Carter attend a musical gala celebrating his 100th birthday in person by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Jimmy Carter physically attends a musical gala celebrating his 100th birthday at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta or a similar venue before August 31, 2024. The event should be specifically organized to honor Carter's centennial. The question resolves as NO if Carter does not attend such an event in person by the resolution date, if the event is canceled, or if it does not occur by August 31, 2024. Attendance via video call or pre-recorded message does not count as physical attendance.

title: Will a musical gala honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday feature at least one Grammy-winning artist?
body: This question resolves as YES if at least one Grammy Award-winning artist performs at the 'Jimmy Carter 100: A Celebration in Song' gala or a similarly named event honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta. The event must take place either on September 17, 2023, or on a rescheduled date before August 31, 2024. The question resolves as NO if no Grammy-winning artists perform, if the event is canceled, or if it does not occur by the resolution date. For the purpose of this question, a Grammy-winning artist is defined as an individual or group who has won at least one Grammy Award in any category prior to their performance at the gala.

title: Will tickets for a musical gala honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday at Atlanta's Fox Theatre sell out within 24 hours of going on sale by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if tickets for a musical gala honoring Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday at the Fox Theatre in Atlanta sell out within 24 hours of being made available to the public. The event must be officially announced and the ticket sale must occur before August 31, 2024. The question resolves as NO if tickets do not sell out within 24 hours, if the event is canceled, or if ticket sales do not begin by the resolution date. For the purpose of this question, 'sell out' means that all publicly available tickets are purchased, excluding any potential reserved seats or special allocations.

title: Will India transfer a $300 million loan to Vietnam for maritime security by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, India has officially transferred a loan of approximately $300 million to Vietnam specifically for the purpose of enhancing Vietnam's maritime security. The transfer must be officially confirmed by either the Indian or Vietnamese government, or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If the loan amount is altered but remains within 10% of $300 million (i.e., between $270 million and $330 million), it will still be considered valid for this question. The question will resolve as NO if the loan transfer is not completed by the specified date, if it is canceled, or if the purpose of the loan is significantly changed from maritime security.

article_information.article_description: India has offered Vietnam a $300 million loan to build up the Southeast Asian country's maritime security, as the two sides say they want to double their trade and investment within five years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday told visiting Vietnamese…

article_information.article_content:
NEW DELHI (AP) India on Thursday offered a $300 million loan to build up Vietnams maritime security, as the two sides said they want to double their trade and investment within five years.
Prime Min… [+1925 chars]

title: Will India and Vietnam announce they have doubled their trade volume by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, official representatives from both India and Vietnam jointly announce that they have successfully doubled their bilateral trade volume compared to the levels reported in late 2023. The announcement must be made through official government channels or reported by at least two reputable international news agencies. The question resolves as NO if no such announcement is made by the specified date, if the reported increase in trade volume is less than double, or if either country officially states that the goal has not been achieved. The baseline for comparison should be the most recent trade volume figures available as of October 2023.

title: Will Vietnam announce the completion of a major maritime security project funded by India by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Vietnamese government officially announces the completion of a significant maritime security project that was funded, wholly or in part, by a loan from India. The project must be directly related to enhancing Vietnam's maritime security capabilities, such as coastal surveillance systems, naval vessels, or port infrastructure. The announcement should be made through official Vietnamese government channels or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The question resolves as NO if no such announcement is made by the specified date, if the announced project is unrelated to maritime security, or if it's explicitly stated that the project was not funded by an Indian loan.

title: Will a political marketing company be fined at least $50,000 for violating election laws in New Hampshire by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a political marketing company is fined $50,000 or more by New Hampshire authorities for violating election laws related to campaign materials or advertisements. The fine must be officially announced by the New Hampshire Attorney General's office or another relevant state authority. The violation must be specifically related to election laws, such as improper disclosures on campaign materials or misleading advertisements. The question will resolve as NO if no such fine is imposed, if the fine is less than $50,000, or if no announcement is made by the resolution date.

title: Will a state other than New Hampshire fine a political marketing company for election law violations by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, any U.S. state other than New Hampshire officially announces a fine against a political marketing company for violating state election laws. The fine must be related to campaign materials, advertisements, or other election-related activities conducted during or after the 2022 election cycle. The announcement must come from the state's official channels, such as the Attorney General's office or the state's election board. The question resolves as NO if no such fine is announced by any other state within the specified timeframe.

title: Will New Hampshire authorities announce investigations into multiple political marketing companies for election law violations by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the New Hampshire Attorney General's office or another relevant state authority publicly announces investigations into two or more distinct political marketing companies for potential violations of state election laws. The investigations must be related to campaign materials, advertisements, or other election-related activities. The announcement must clearly indicate that multiple companies are under investigation, even if specific company names are not provided. The question resolves as NO if fewer than two companies are announced to be under investigation within the specified timeframe, or if no such announcement is made.

title: Will another inmate be sentenced for involvement in James 'Whitey' Bulger's death by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a U.S. court sentences an additional inmate (other than Paul J. DeCologero) for their involvement in the 2018 prison killing of James 'Whitey' Bulger. The sentencing must be directly related to Bulger's death and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such sentencing occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will a federal investigation into prison safety measures be announced by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a federal agency (such as the Department of Justice or the Federal Bureau of Prisons) announces an official investigation into prison safety measures in U.S. federal prisons. The announcement must be made through official channels and reported by at least two reputable mainstream news outlets. The investigation does not need to explicitly cite the James 'Whitey' Bulger case, but it should focus on overall prison safety measures. If no such investigation is announced by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

The policy must be officially announced and directly address the safety concerns for notable inmates in the federal prison system. The announcement must be reported by at least two reputable news organizations. If no such policy is implemented and announced by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the US and Russia complete a prisoner swap involving at least 3 individuals by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, the United States and Russia conduct a prisoner exchange involving at least three individuals (in total, across both countries). The swap must be officially confirmed by government sources or widely reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The question resolves as NO if no such swap occurs within the specified timeframe or if any swap involves fewer than three individuals. For the purpose of this question, 'prisoner swap' refers to a coordinated exchange of detained individuals between the two countries, typically involving persons held on espionage or other politically sensitive charges.

title: Will Evan Gershkovich publish a book about his experiences in Russia by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Evan Gershkovich, a U.S. journalist who was detained in Russia in 2023, publishes a book (in any format, including e-book) detailing his experiences in Russia. The book must be officially released and available for purchase from major book retailers. It resolves as NO if no such book is published by the specified date. For the purpose of this question, the book should primarily focus on his time in Russia, including his detention, but may also cover other related topics.

title: Will a US journalist be detained in Russia on espionage charges by August, 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a journalist holding U.S. citizenship is newly detained in Russia on charges of espionage or related accusations. The detention must be officially reported by Russian authorities and confirmed by U.S. government sources or widely reported by major international news organizations. It resolves as NO if no such new detention occurs by the specified date. This question does not consider any ongoing detentions that began before October 1, 2023.

title: Will the US State Department issue a travel advisory against Russia for US journalists by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Department of State issues an official travel advisory specifically warning U.S. journalists about the risks of traveling to Russia. The advisory must explicitly mention journalists or media professionals as a targeted group. The advisory should be distinct from general travel warnings and focus on the potential risks faced by journalists in particular. Factors that might lead to such an advisory could include detentions of journalists, harassment, or other threats to press freedom in Russia. This question resolves as NO if no such specific advisory is issued by the specified date.

body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vladimir Kara-Murza is officially nominated for a Nobel Peace Prize. The nomination must be confirmed by the Nobel Committee or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. For context, Kara-Murza is a Russian dissident and journalist known for his opposition to the Russian government. The question resolves as NO if no such nomination is made or confirmed by the specified date.

title: Will the number of Americans filing for jobless claims exceed 300,000 in a single week by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Labor reports that the number of Americans filing for initial unemployment benefits (jobless claims) exceeds 300,000 in any single week. The resolution will be based on the official weekly report released by the U.S. Department of Labor. If no such report shows jobless claims exceeding 300,000 in a single week by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will a week of jobless claims in the U.S. surpass the July 2023 high by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Labor reports a week where the number of Americans filing for initial unemployment benefits (jobless claims) exceeds 249,000. This threshold is based on the high recorded in July 2023, which was considered the highest level in a year at that time. The resolution will be based on the official weekly jobless claims reports released by the U.S. Department of Labor. If no such report shows jobless claims surpassing 249,000 in a single week by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. This question aims to gauge the health of the U.S. labor market in the context of changing economic conditions.

title: Will the U.S. implement a rule banning airlines from charging extra for family seating by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Transportation officially implements and puts into effect a rule that prohibits airlines from charging additional fees for parents to sit with their children aged 13 or younger on flights. The rule must be substantially similar to the proposal described in early 2023, which aimed to ensure that young children can be seated next to an accompanying adult without extra charges. The question resolves as NO if the rule is not implemented, if it is significantly altered from the original proposal, or if its implementation is delayed beyond the specified date.

Under the proposal, released Thursday, U.S. and foreign carriers would be required to seat children 13 or younger nex…

title: Will a major U.S. airline voluntarily adopt a policy to seat children with parents at no extra charge by August, 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least one of the top 5 U.S. airlines by passenger volume announces and implements a policy to seat children aged 13 or younger with their parents or guardians without charging additional fees. The policy must be publicly announced and put into practice before the resolution date. If no such policy is adopted by any major U.S. airline, or if the policies implemented still allow for additional charges in some cases, the question resolves as NO. This question is posed in the context of ongoing discussions about airline seating policies for families.

title: Will major U.S. airlines strongly oppose the proposed child seating rule by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least three major U.S. airlines or airline industry associations publicly oppose or file formal objections to the Department of Transportation's proposed rule to ban charges for seating children with parents. Opposition must be reported by at least two reputable news sources. Major U.S. airlines include American Airlines, Delta Air Lines, United Airlines, Southwest Airlines, and JetBlue Airways. Relevant industry associations include Airlines for America (A4A) and the International Air Transport Association (IATA). If fewer than three major airlines or associations publicly oppose the rule, or if opposition is not widely reported, the question resolves as NO. The proposed rule aims to ensure that children 13 or younger can be seated next to an accompanying adult without additional fees.

title: Will Nigeria declare a state of emergency due to mass protests by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Nigerian government officially declares a state of emergency in response to mass protests related to the country's economic situation. The declaration must be made by the President or an authorized government official and reported by at least two major international news outlets. The state of emergency must be nationwide or cover at least three major cities. Mass protests are defined as demonstrations involving at least 10,000 people across multiple locations in the country. If no such declaration is made by the specified date, or if the protests do not meet the criteria for 'mass protests', the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the death toll from Nigeria's economic protests exceed 10 by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the confirmed death toll from protests related to Nigeria's economic situation reaches or exceeds 10 people. The death toll must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and attributed directly to protest-related incidents, including clashes with security forces. Deaths must be explicitly linked to protests about economic issues in Nigeria. If the reported death toll remains below 10 by the specified date, or if there is significant uncertainty about the cause or number of deaths, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will a major international organization intervene in Nigeria's economic crisis by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a major international organization (such as the United Nations, International Monetary Fund, or World Bank) announces a significant intervention or aid package specifically aimed at addressing Nigeria's economic challenges. The intervention must be valued at least $100 million USD and be officially announced by the organization. The intervention should be in response to economic issues, which may include factors such as inflation, unemployment, or currency devaluation. If no such intervention is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that routine or pre-planned assistance programs not directly tied to the current economic situation will not qualify for a YES resolution.

title: Will Nigeria's government implement major economic reforms in response to protests by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's government announces and begins implementing a set of major economic reforms in direct response to widespread protests. These reforms must include at least two of the following: significant currency policy changes, major subsidy adjustments, or substantial changes to fiscal policy. The reforms must be officially announced by the government and reported by at least two major international news outlets. If no such reforms are implemented by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the NHTSA conclude its investigation into a Tesla 'Full Self-Driving' crash by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) officially concludes and releases findings from its investigation into the April 2023 crash near Seattle involving a Tesla operating on 'Full Self-Driving' mode that resulted in a motorcyclist fatality. The conclusion must be publicly announced through official NHTSA channels or reported by at least two reputable news organizations. If the investigation remains ongoing or no official conclusion is released by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. Note: The investigation was announced in August 2023.

title: Will Tesla suspend its 'Full Self-Driving' feature in the United States by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Tesla officially announces a suspension or temporary halt of its 'Full Self-Driving' feature for vehicles in the United States. The suspension must be company-wide and apply to all Tesla vehicles equipped with the feature. The announcement must be made through official Tesla channels or reported by at least two major news outlets. If Tesla continues to offer the 'Full Self-Driving' feature without interruption until the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will a U.S. state ban Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' feature by August 2024?

The ban must be officially announced by the state government and reported by at least two major news outlets. If no U.S. state has implemented such a ban by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.
